page.title: 13INTERVIEW WITH MRS. HONESS
page.content: {Mrs Honess told me}there used to be a, coal yard & there used to be a fun fair every year at Cox's yard until the houses were built.There used to be a sweet shop by the railway.Alot of the woodlands have been ploughed up. You had to walk everywhere if you had no bicycle. There were hardly any cars so if you had a bicycle you had to make do with it. A majority of people used horse & cart.Horses used to come on the trains to the races,because there were no lorries.There was no milkman so people had to get their milk from the creamary which was by the railway station. There was once a breeze block factory but now it is closed.In March 1983,Prince Charles visited Plumpton race course & rode a horse in one of the races. Since 1965 more houses have been built but the public transport has lessened.
